contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox District DE | name=Weißenfels | state=Saxony-Anhalt | former regierungsbezirk=[[Halle (region)|Halle]] | dissolved = 2007-07-01 | capital=[[Weißenfels]] | area=372.41 | population= 74,913 | population_as_of=2004 | density=206 | carsign=WSF | url=[http://www.landkreis-weissenfels.de landkreis-weissenfels.de] | map=saxony_anhalt_wsf.png }} '''Weißenfels''' was a district (''Kreis'') in the south of [[Saxony-Anhalt]], [[Germany]]. Neighboring districts were (from south clockwise) [[Burgenlandkreis (former district)|Burgenlandkreis]], [[Merseburg-Querfurt]] and the [[Free State of Saxony|Saxon]] district [[Leipziger Land]]. == History == Near the small town [[Goseck]] [[archaeology|archaeologists]] discovered in 1999 the oldest solar observatory in Europe, beating [[Stonehenge]] by more than 2000 years. Around 5000 BC the circular trench with a diameter of 75 meters was surrounded with wood palisades, with three openings which allowed to measure the date of the spring and autumn [[equinox]]. Excavations on the site are planned to continue until 2007. The district in today's borders was created in 1994, when the two previous districts Weissenfels and Hohenmölsen were merged. == Geography == The main river in the district is the [[Saale]], with [[wine|viticulture]] along the river valley. In the east of the district is the [[lignite]] open pit mining area of Hohenmölsen. <!--==Partnerships==--> == Coat of arms == {| |- valign=top ||[[Image:Wappen Landkreis Weissenfels.svg|140px|Coat of arms]] ||The main feature in the coat of arms is the blue band representing the river Saale. The [[Prussia]]n eagle in the top-right was added as the area became part of Prussia in 1816, even though it historically belonged to [[Saxony]]. The [[clover]]leaf with the mining symbols inside was taken from the coat of arms of the former district Hohenmölsen. The trefoil represented the agriculture in that district, the mining hammers the lignite mining. |} ==Towns and municipalities== {| ! width=30% align=left|Towns ! width=70% align=left|[[Amt (political division)|Verwaltungsgemeinschaften]] |- valign=top || #[[Hohenmölsen]] || #[[Lützen-Wiesengrund]] (incl. town [[Lützen]]) #[[Saaletal]] #[[Vier Berge-Teucherner Land]] (incl. town [[Teuchern]]) #[[Weißenfels|Weißenfelser Land]] (incl. town Weißenfels) |} == External links == *[http://www.landkreis-weissenfels.de Official website] (German) {{Germany districts saxony-anhalt}} {{Cities and towns in Weißenfels (district)}} {{coord missing|Germany}}
